page.title: 10CHANGES IN BRIDGE SINCE 1953
page.content: In the centre of Bridge there is an estate called Western Avenue. It was built in 1963 where Daddy Fagg's dairy farm was.Every year the Flower Show was held in his field at which there was a small fair. Opposite Daddy Fagg's farm there was a Blacksmith's Forge.It is now a private house. There was a Riding School in the High Street and a piano makers and tuners. There were trees along the sides of the High Street. From 1960 onwards more and more houses were built at Bridgedown, Bridgeford Way, Riverside Close and Conyngham Lane. This meant that new shops were built. The new houses had garages because by that time many people had cars.Traffic through Bridge increased and it became very dangerous, especially the big lorries. The Bridge Bypass was opened in 1976.
